intro: Panax rhododendrifolius, commonly known as the red-flowered ginseng, is a rare and endangered plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers and distinctive, compound leaves. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, with roots containing compounds similar to those found in Panax ginseng. It thrives in cool, shaded environments with well-drained soil. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is critically endangered and protected in several conservation programs.
